content.question: Which of the following best describes an overall argument of the excerpt?

choices.label: The makeup of emigrant populations led to greater reconstruction of English family life in New England than it did in the Chesapeake.
British colonial settlers were disproportionately young and male compared to the overall population of England.
Tobacco and sugar plantations in the southern colonies attracted the most settlers in British North America.
By the end of the seventeenth century, the population makeup of the British colonies resembled the population makeup of England.

content.answer: The makeup of emigrant populations led to greater reconstruction of English family life in New England than it did in the Chesapeake.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Identify and describe a claim and/or argument in a text-based or non-text-based source.
